intro: Arenaria lycopodioides, commonly known as the sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
